chapter.title: Monitoring Administrative Documents
chapter.para: The items in the Monitoring submenu pertain to the Kuali Service Bus and the Kuali Enterprise Workflow (KEW) as well as the Application Server.

An Enterprise Service Bus is a middleware architecture construct which allows for integrating enterprise applications in an implementation-independent fashion. The Kuali Service Bus (KSB) specifically provides a messaging fabric as well as allowing acquisition of services on the bus using a service registry and invocation of those services using various protocols (java serialization over HTTP and SOAP). Because these are primarily technical operations, they are not covered in great detail here.
Use of these options is restricted to users with the KR-SYS Technical Administrator role.

section.title: Cache Management
section.para:
Admin
> Monitoring
> Service Bus
> Cache Admin
> Cache Management

The Cache Management tool is used to clear all or individual local system caches. Users may select specific or all caches and click Flush
.

tip.para: Click the arrow on the left of the checkbox to expand the list.

section.title: Configuration Viewer
section.para:
Admin
> Monitoring
> Service Bus
> Configuration Viewer
> Configuration Properties
The Configuration Viewer is used to review a table of configured properties. Click Refresh Page to update the values.

section.title: Java Melody
section.para:
Admin
> Monitoring
> Service Bus
> Java Melody
> Statistics of JavaMelody

section.title:
Message Queue Message Queue
Service Bus submenu group Message Queue
section.para:
Admin
> Monitoring
> Service Bus
> Message Queue
The Message Queue allows administrators to monitor messages that are flowing through the Service Bus. Messages can be edited, deleted or forwarded to other machines for processing from this screen.

mediaobject.alt: Sample Message from the Message Queue

section.title: Quartz
section.para:
Admin
> Monitoring
> Service Bus
> Quartz
Quartz provides a means by which an administrator can schedule delayed tasks, including retry attempts for messages that cannot be sent the first time.

section.title: Security Management
section.para:
Admin
> Monitoring
> Service Bus
> Security Management
The Security Management provides a means by which an administrator can generate a keystore in the Kuali Service Bus (KSB).

section.title:
Service Registry Service Registry
Service Bus submenu group Service Registry
section.para:
Admin
> Monitoring
> Service Bus
> Service Registry

The Service Registry displays a read-only view of the Service Bus's Service Registry. The Service Registry shows all services that are exposed on the Service Bus and includes information about them (such as IP Address, endpoint URL, etc.). The Service Registry also includes an administrative function which allows the administrator to refresh its view of the registry.

section.title:
Thread Pool Thread Pool
Service Bus submenu group Thread Pool
section.para:
Admin
> Monitoring
> Service Bus
> Thread Pool
The Thread Pool provides a means by which an administrator can change the size of the Thread Pool used by the Service Bus for processing messages.

section.title:
Document Operation Document Operation option
Workflow submenu group Document Operation option
section.para:
Admin
> Monitoring
> Workflow
> Document Operation
The Document Operation screen allows for low-level modifications to document data; users can manually move a particular document to the next step in the workflow, refresh the document, etc.

In certain scenarios or failure cases it may be necessary to make modifications to the document so that the state of the document in the KEW system is consistent with that of OLE. It may also be necessary to make modifications to the XML content of a document if, for example, there is a bug in the application integrating with KEW which results in incomplete or insufficient XML content to allow for proper routing.

tip.para: In KFS, Document Operation is restricted to very few users and is used primarily to requeue doucments when a fiscal officer leaves and has things remaining in their Action List. After the account is updated with the new fiscal officer, KFS system admin will requeue the documents and then the system puts them in the new fiscal officer's Action List.
Instead of trying to push documents through the workflow with Document Operation, KFS users try to use Super User instead.

section.para:
Enter the document ID you are searching for and click Get Document
.
The administrator is then presented with a view of the document and can perform various operations on it. The screen is divided into various sections, including:

listitem.para: Document Actions - Additional functions for reassigning and reprocessing document
Document - simple data associated with the document
Action Requests - the Action Requests associated with the document, includes requests for action which have already been satisfied
Actions Taken - The actions that have been taken against this document (i.e. Approved by user X)
Action Items - Items related to this document that are in users' Action Lists
Route Node Instances - The node instances that form the document's instantiated route path
Branch States - The branches on this document and the state of those branches
Annotation - An annotation that will show up on the Route Log when the operation is performed.

entry.para: Requeuing and reprocessing the document by the engine
Update searchable data of the document
Refresh document and regenerate request of current node
Move blanket approve document forward; User, Action Taken Id, and Node Names are required

listitem.para: Action Taken Id - Enter an entry's action taken Id
Node Names - Enter a comma separated list of node names

entry.para: Reassign action request based on initiator, entry ID, and action code; User, Action Item Id, and Action Code are required

listitem.para: Action Item Id - Enter an entry's action item Id
Action Code - A, F, K, or C; A for Approve, F for FYI, K for acknowledge, and C for Complete

entry.para: The workflow id of the initiator
The ID of the initial route node instance on the document
The current status of the document
A legacy field providing a numerical representation of where the document is in the route path
The initial date the document was created, doesn't not reflect whether the document was routed, saved, etc.
The date at which the document's status was last modified
The date at which the document's state transitioned to APPROVED
The date at which the document's state transitioned to FINAL
Legacy value, similar to Doc Status Modification Date
The ID of the DocumentType definition for this document
A special id that can be set by client applications to associate the document to an ID in their system
The XML Content of the document
The workflow id of the initiator
The ID of the node instance that this request is attached to
The type of action that is requested
The date the request was created
The current status of the request
The activation priority of the request
A legacy field providing a numerical representation of where in the route path the request was generated
The id of the responsibility associated with this request (relates to Rules and/or Route Modules)
A description of the responsibility of this request
ID of the parent action request if there is one
The type of recipient for this request (user, workgroup, or role)
If the recipient type is "user", the workflow id of the user recipient
If the recipient type is "workgroup", the workgroup id of the workgroup recipient
If the recipient type is "role", the name of the role
If the recipient type is "role", the value of the qualified role
If the recipient type is "role", the label for the qualified role
If this request has been satisfied, the id of the ActionTaken that satisfied the request
The ignore previous indicator of the request
The approve policy of the request (only used by role requests)
If the request is a delegation, the type of delegation (primary or secondary)
Indicates if the request is "Current" or not
The value of the annotation on the request
The ID of the associated document
The type of the action that was taken
The date at which the action was taken
The workflow id of the user or delegate who took action
If this action was performed by a delegate, the workflow id of the person whose authority was delegated
If this action was performed by a delegate, the workflow id of the Workgroup whose authority was delegated
Indicates if the Action Taken is "Current" or not, non-current actions have been revoked by an action such as ReturnToPreviousNode
The value of the annotation on the Action Taken

section.title: Action Items
section.para: It is important to note that the Action Items is a de-normalized representation of an Action Request on the document that is used to render the Action List in an efficient matter. Therefore, it contains some copies of data from both the document and the request itself.

entry.para: The ID of the associated document
The name of the DocumentType for this item
The label of the document type
The URL used to access the doc handler for this item
The creation date of the item
The ID of the Action Request from which this item is derived
The type of action requested by this item
The responsibility id of the associated request
The workflow id of the person responsible for the item
The workgroup id of the workgroup responsible for the item
If the item was derived from a role request, the name of the role
If the item was delegated, the workflow id of the delegating party
If the item was delegated, the workgroup id of the delegating party

section.title: Route Node Instances
section.para: The Route Node Instances are modeled as a Directed Acyclic Graph starting at the node instance pointed to by the Initial Route Node Instances field in the Document section. Therefore, if you delete a route node instance, it will follow all links through its set of Next Route Node Instances and delete those as well.

mediaobject.alt: Document Operations: Route Node Instances Tab

entry.para: Indicates if the node is active
Indicates if the node's processing has completed
Indicates if the node has been processed by the engine yet
A comma-separated display of the IDs of the previous Route Node Instances of the node
A comma-separated display of the IDs of the next Route Node Instances of the node
A representation of the state attached to the node

section.title: Branch States
section.para: All documents are required to have at least one branch that is named PRIMARY. Therefore, it is advisable to not rename the PRIMARY branch.

entry.para: The ID of that piece of branch state
The key of the branch state
The value of the branch state

section.title: Annotation
section.para: Here you can enter an annotation explaining the changes being made. This will be logged on the Route Log so that it can be preserved as part of the audit trail for the document.

Once the changes have been made on the document operation screen, hit the Save button and the changes will be executed on the server. Remember that in order for a change to take place the appropriate radio button must be selected on the data that requires modification.

section.title:
Statistics Report Statistics Report
Workflow submenu group Statistics Report
section.para:
Admin
> Monitoring
> Workflow
> Statisticas Report
The Statistics Report displays the counts of documents and users for various statuses and categories.
